meaning_str.bing:
v. 分离；区分；隔开；区别
adj. 单独的；独立的；分开的；不同的
n. (杂志论文的)抽印本；单行本；可以不配套单独穿的妇女服装
网络. 分离的；分居；分隔

单独的；独立的；分开的；不同的
(杂志论文的)抽印本；单行本；可以不配套单独穿的妇女服装

分开；使分开；分离；使分离；区分；隔开；分割；划分；阻隔；分居
分开的；独立的；不相连的；个别的；各自的；单独的；不相关的；互不相关的；不同的；区别的
可搭配穿着的单件衣物；自成一体的物件；独立音响组件；分隔物；隔断物；分层设备；单行本；抽印本

1.en: But separate research by the bank suggests that the rise in trade barriers has so far affected only a small part of global commerce.
1.cn: 但世界银行进行的另一项研究显示，迄今为止，贸易壁垒的提高仅仅影响了很小一部分全球贸易。

2.en: When it comes to reducing carbon emissions, the question "How much? " is separate from the equally important question "How? "
2.cn: 在谈到削减碳排放时，“削减多少”与同等重要的“如何削减”是不同的问题。

3.en: In a separate pre-trial hearing on Monday, he said he was innocent.
3.cn: 在星期一举行的另一次审前听证中，他说他是清白的。

0.en: I know a lot of students here at Oxford have your own separate bedrooms, but when I was a freshman at Williams College, I was not so fortunate.
0.cn: 我知道这里，牛津的许多学生有自己单独的卧室，但我进入威廉姆斯学院的时候，我没有那么幸运。

1.en: There are separate showers for both sexes.
1.cn: 这里有男女分开的浴室。

2.en: Rach, do you, are you gonna separate those?
2.cn: 瑞秋，你不打算分开洗吗？

3.en: You're at that age when you want to separate. Yeah, I separate from you, not the other way around.
3.cn: 你到了想独立自主的年纪。是我从你那独立出来，而不是反过来。

4.en: But we have to separate that out. It can't affect our plan.
4.cn: 但我们得排除那些，不能让它影响我们的计划。

5.en: And on a totally separate subject, that is a lovely pantsuit.

6.en: I run the hydrazine around an iridium catalyst. It will separate into N2 and H2.
6.cn: 我将肼用铱催化，它会分解为氮气和氢气。

7.en: Oh, come on. Your Honor, if Mr. Schmidt's clients wish to bring a separate suit...
7.cn: 得了吧，法官阁下，如果施密特先生的当事人想另行起诉...

8.en: When the IRS questions us in separate rooms, we need to have our stories straight.
8.cn: 当我们被关在不同房间被国税局审问时，我们的答案必须一致啊。

9.en: It's not a simple pass-fail. It's an evaluation tool we use to separate applicants.
9.cn: 考试不是通过没通过这么简单，而是我们区分申请者的评估手段。

10.en: Access the elevator with fingerprint recognition and open 3 separate combination locks.
10.cn: 进入搭载装有指纹识别系统的电梯，然后分别打开三个组合密码锁。

11.en: Fine, I'll tell you. A lichen is an organism made up of two separate species, fungi and algae.
11.cn: 还是跟你们分享一下吧，地衣是由菌类和藻类这两不同的物种组成的复合有机体。

12.en: No, I'm getting three separate heartbeats. Three? You guys were worried I wouldn't even have one.
12.cn: 不是，我听到三个心跳音。三个？你们还担心我怀不成。

13.en: I, personally, will see to it that your organs are removed and placed in separate jewel-encrusted jars. Thank you.
13.cn: 我，将亲自监督你的内脏被移除并分别放入镶满宝石的罐子里。谢谢。

14.en: All right, guys, tell you what. Let's split the class into two separate businesses and see how you do for yourselves.
14.cn: 好的，同学们，接下来，咱们把全班分成两个独立的公司来看看你们会为自己做些什么。

15.en: Another piece of advice, is that couples use separate blankets if one of the partners is a particularly restless sleeper.
15.cn: 另一个建议，如果情侣中有人较晚睡，可以用不同的被子。

16.en: I don't understand. Yes, we shared a uterus for nine months, but since then we've pretty much gone our own separate ways.
16.cn: 我不明白，不错，我们共同在一个子宫里待过九个月，但此后我们就你走阳关道，我走独木桥了。

17.en: You know, both selective mutism and an inability to separate from one's mother can stem from a pathological fear of women.
17.cn: 无论是选择性缄默症还是无法离开母亲独自生活，都可能是源于对女性的病理性恐惧。

18.en: On my 12th birthday, I really wanted a titanium centrifuge, so, you know, I could separate radioactive isotopes. Of course.
18.cn: 我12岁生日的时候，我非常想要一个钛离心分离机，这样，我就可以分离放射性同位素了。当然。

19.en: And when the two worlds are separate, everything is fine. When you have romantic love and work for hire, everything is fine.
19.cn: 这两个世界分开时，所有事情都井井有条，你同时拥有爱情和工作时，两者并不冲突。
